name: Soju & Slurp 🥢🍶
description:
We’re back with another edition of Soju & Slurp on 14th September at my cozy spot in JP Nagar! 🌿🍜
This isn’t just a meal—it’s an intimate experience where you get to explore authentic, homemade vegetarian Korean food in a fun and interactive setting. Expect steaming bowls of tteokbokki, our signature kimbap, house-fermented kimchi, and refreshing soju cocktails, all served with stories, laughter, and a warm community vibe. 💕

If you’ve been curious about Korean food or simply love trying something offbeat, this is your chance. Come hungry, curious, and ready to sip, slurp, and connect!

name: Kalaripayattu Movement
description:
Hey Sisters,
Get ready to step into the ancient flow of Kalari — a powerful body-mind practice that’s playful, structured, and deeply transformative! This movement art will help you find balance, build flexibility, sharpen focus, and awaken parts of your body you probably haven’t moved in years (or ever!).
Expect to feel strong, grounded, and centered, while tapping into an ancient wisdom that connects body, mind, and spirit. It’s not just fitness — it’s a lifestyle that brings vitality, energy, and inner calm.
Date: 21st September (Sunday)
Time: 10:30 AM- 12:00 PM
Place: Dizzy Duck Studio, Koramangala
Are you ready to move like never before and unleash your power?

name: Taekwondo Workshop
description:
Hey Ladies!
Get ready to kick, punch, and power up your energy at this Taekwondo Workshop! Whether you’re looking to build strength, learn self-defense, or just try something new, this session will leave you feeling confident and unstoppable.
Date: 14th September | Sunday
Time: 4:00 – 5:00 PM
Place: Hi-Kick Taekwondo Federation, Govindapura
Learn beginner-friendly techniques, build balance & flexibility, and discover the warrior in you — all while having a blast!
Don’t miss out on this chance to unleash your inner warrior!

name: Whimsical Weekend with Improv Lore
description:
We bring you some whimsy this weekend for those who can’t make it to our Wednesday jams.

Whether you’re a novice to theatre, a maverick on stage, or just dipping your toes into the world of unscripted performance, this Jam is designed for everyone. Our facilitators will guide you through a series of engaging improv exercises, help you explore new characters, and set up scenarios that will make your inner wit shine - all on the spot!

Come as you are, leave your inhibitions at the door, and join us on this journey of endless possibility.

Bring a friend, a date, or a group - our brave space is for everyone!

Who are Improv Lore?

We are Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, works towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.

name: Pint of View (Lecture 3): Too Hot to Handle
description:
Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.

This edition, we’re bringing you Apekshita Varshney, journalist, development professional, and founder of HeatWatch—a volunteer-run initiative tracking the human cost of rising heat. From unreported deaths to overlooked vulnerabilities, Apekshita’s work sheds light on the hidden toll of India’s growing climate crisis.

In her talk Too Hot to Handle: India’s Growing Climate Crisis, she’ll explore how heat silently reshapes our lives, how unprepared our cities really are, and what building resilience could mean, all sparking conversations over Geist beer on tap at Jamming Goat 3.0 in Indiranagar.

What to Expect:

•⁠  ⁠A 45-minute lecture revealing the lived realities of climate change in India
•⁠  ⁠15 minutes of interactive Q&A to dive deeper into the solutions and challenges
•⁠  ⁠A chance to understand how global warming impacts human lives and reshapes human stories
•⁠  ⁠One Geist beer on tap included with your ticket
•⁠  ⁠A lively mixer where you can connect with curious minds and share your own perspectives on climate, community, and change

This isn’t your typical climate talk. Through storytelling and lived experience, we’ll look squarely at one of the most urgent crises of our time, together, in the informal setting of a pub lecture.

Event Details:

📅 Saturday, 14th September | 4:00 PM – 6:00 PM
📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar
🎫 Limited to 60 attendees only
💰 Early bird pricing available for the first 10 tickets

About the Lecturer

Apekshita Varshney is the founder of HeatWatch, an organisation dedicated to tackling the escalating threat of heatwaves and their profound impacts on communities. She has worked with Indian and international organisations on government and corporate accountability, sustainable urban development, and climate change. A Commonwealth Master’s Scholar at University College London, she holds a Master’s degree in Urban Development Planning. She founded HeatWatch with coaching and funding support from the Mira Fellowship.

About Pint of View

Inspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the US, Pint of View brings this revolutionary format to India for the very first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand, walking out with a new way of seeing the world.

name: RA.SA Sessions: Vol 1
description: Kavan Kuttappa of Eat Naru and Anurag Arora of The Apartment come together for a candid dialogue on how Bangalore eats, drinks and creates culture

name: Paired Up - Chef Kalyan x SDU Wines
description:
A wine dinner built for meat lovers only. Think bold naati flavours reimagined through a five-course menu, each savoury dish paired to perfection with SDU wines. Chef Kalyan’s taking the lead on the food, and together it’s going to be a pairing you won’t forget.

Course 1
Kothmiri meenu
Coriander-Lemon Grilled seabass, potato chips, Old Bangalore style
SDU Reserva Chardonnay
Course 2
Miriyalu Pitta
Peppered up quail, mini idlis
SDU Reserva Syrah
Course 3
Kaalchina Pandi Maamsam
Grilled pork skewers, akki rottil
SDU Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon
Course 4
Bannur Kuri Chops
Bannur Lamb Chops, Khaima pongal
SDU Wine Maker's Selection
Course 5
Pheni
Pheni, milk, served the Old Bangalore way

name: ⁠Paired Up - Chef Kalyan X SDU Winery
description:
A wine dinner built for meat lovers only. Think bold naati flavours reimagined through a five-course menu, each savoury dish paired to perfection with SDU wines. Chef Kalyan’s taking the lead on the food, and together it’s going to be a pairing you won’t forget.

Course 1

Coriander-Lemon Grilled seabass, potato chips, Old Bangalore style
SDU Reserva Chardonnay

Course 5
Pheni
Pheni, milk, served the Old Bangalore way

name: Japanese Cinema - Floating Weeds by Yasujiro Ozu
description:
Film Screening by Bangalore Film Forum

Floating Weeds (1959)

By Yasujiro Ozu / 119 mins / Japanese with eng subs

One of six sublime color masterworks that Yasujiro Ozu produced late in his career, the director’s second filming of his own 1934 silent triumph A Story of Floating Weeds represents the mature flowering of his style. Harnessing the full expressive potential of color, sound, music, and his exquisite compositional sense, he brings new depths of bittersweet feeling—tinged with an aging artist’s melancholic nostalgia—as well as a new air of expansiveness, to a story with enduring resonance.

name: Unfiltered presented by Original Dog : Words with Thought Brownie
description:
Presenting an artist who make the most of the written word.

Thought Brownie writes stories and performs it in the form of rap. Stories inspired by literature, philosophy and a deep curiosity to understand and celebrate life.

He named himself after his favourite edible, a brownie be once ate in Amsterdam. IYKYK. Once it hit, he realised how every time he wrote, good things happened in his life.

He figured he could keep writing and see what adventures that got him into.

Through his words and his verse, he hopes to bring you a little surprise, a little delight and a little warmth. Just like a decent edible.

name: Honestly Bengaluru Food Trail
description:
Come hungry and leave with a tummy full of stories on our Honestly Bengaluru Food Trail through the heritage lanes of Basavanagudi! From piping hot filter coffee to nostalgic snacks, legendary eateries, and melt-in-your-mouth sweets — this trail is a true celebration of Bengaluru’s culinary soul.

We kick things off at the historic Dodda Basavanagudi Temple, where you’ll discover how this neighbourhood came to life and why it remains one of the city’s most loved localities. Then it’s time to fuel up with Bengaluru’s signature filter coffee, before heading into the bustle of DVG Road to sample quirky bites with even quirkier backstories. Along the way, we drop by an iconic family home for a treasured heirloom snack and explore age-old bazaars that still hum with life.

And of course, no Bengaluru trail is complete without a pit stop at an iconic eatery serving the city’s most beloved dishes, followed by a sweet ending that will have you coming back for more.

This isn’t just a food walk — it’s a deep dive into Bengaluru’s history, heritage, and flavours, perfect for mornings or evenings alike!

Highlights:
-  Discover the heritage of Basavanagudi at the iconic Dodda Basavanagudi Temple
-  Explore the geological and cultural wonders of the neighbourhood
-  Experience Bengaluru’s coffee culture with a classic filter coffee
-  Enjoy a traditional homemade snack with a family heirloom recipe
-  Taste iconic dishes at legendary local eateries
-  Stroll down DVG Road and hear quirky snack stories
-  End on a sweet note with a signature Bengaluru dessert

Exclusions:
-  Pick-Up and Drop
-  Food and drink ordered outside of the menu planned by us.
-  Sightseeing points that fall outside of the curated route.
-  We do not provide umbrellas, raincoats, hats/caps, face-masks or sanitizers.Hotel pickups and drops.

name: Kalaripayattu Movement
description:
Hey Sisters,
Get ready to step into the ancient flow of Kalari — a powerful body-mind practice that’s playful, structured, and deeply transformative! This movement art will help you find balance, build flexibility, sharpen focus, and awaken parts of your body you probably haven’t moved in years (or ever!).
Expect to feel strong, grounded, and centered, while tapping into an ancient wisdom that connects body, mind, and spirit. It’s not just fitness — it’s a lifestyle that brings vitality, energy, and inner calm.
Date: 21st September (Sunday)
Time: 10:30 AM- 12:00 PM
Place: Dizzy Duck Studio, Koramangala
Are you ready to move like never before and unleash your power?

name: Yoga with Sisters & Misters
description:
Yoga - With the Sisters and Misters
PLEASE BRING YOUR OWN MATS :))
Progressive Vinyasa classes with Chanchal are a blend of breath work, strong but approachable flow, mindful postural focus, and deep soothing support.
Classes cultivate balance, stability, flexibility, mobility and vigor as the asana ebbs and flows between effort and ease.
Students can expect a mix of both traditional lineage based practices & progressive movement intended for modern bodies and demands.
Yoga Instructor: Chanchal
Meeting time: 8:15 
Meeting Point: CCD Square
For any further queries contact
Vaibhavi - 9886520914
Chanchal- 9886133664

name: Pole Workshop With Azdah
description:
POLE WITH AZDAH IS BACK!
Hey Sisters, get ready for your second pole sesh with Azdah! This class is all about learning the fundamentals — fun spins, climbs & a lil’ choreography to tie it all together.
Date: 20th September, Saturday
Time: 2:30- 4:30 PM
Place: Azdah Pole, Indiranagar
Carry:
Short bicycle shorts (above mid-thigh / swimsuit works too — skin contact = grip!)
Water bottle (no disposables at the studio)
No moisturiser 12 hrs before (unless very dry skin, then light moisturiser ~3 hrs before)
An open mind & heart!
Expect:
Friction burns (they’re normal!) Upper body muscles working hard
It might feel tricky at first, but pole is about practice, not perfection!
You’ll be amazed at how much strength & confidence you build in just one class!
See you on the pole Ladies!

name: Chai Time - Japan Style
description:
**Chai Time – Japan Style** 🌿✨

Imagine chai time… but with a serene Japanese twist. Step away from the rush of the city and slow down with us in an evening designed to calm the mind and delight the senses.

We begin with the gentle art of matcha whisking – not just watching, but doing it yourself. The soft swirls of the bamboo whisk, the frothy green glow of the tea, and the mindful rhythm will help you experience what the Japanese call *ichigo ichie* – a once-in-a-lifetime moment. 🍵

Next, indulge in the delicate chewiness of fresh mochi, a treat that carries both comfort and celebration in every bite. While you savor your mochi, you’ll be invited to pause and reflect write down your hopes, dreams, or secret wishes, and hang them on our **Japanese Wishing Tree*

It’s a cultural escape where you slow down, sip, share, and smile. Calm yet joyful, simple yet unforgettable. 💚

name: Silent Reading
description: Too busy to read lately? Here’s your pause button. Step away from the rush and gift yourself two quiet hours with a book and a warm cup of coffee. No deadlines, no distractions - just you, the pages, and a little peace. Bring along your own read or pick one from our shelves and let yourself sink into the story you’ve been meaning to get back to.

name: Supper Clubs Of India: A Coastal Thali
description:
Bengaluru Servd and NIC Ice Creams present: Supper Clubs of India - Bengaluru Edition, a series of intimate dining experiences highlighting regional community-style meals and cuisines from across India!

For our next Supper, Kari Apla, Mumbai is presenting the best of Coastal cuisines with an all-you-can-eat Thali!
They’ve got a hearty meal in store featuring some of their bestsellers such as the Mushroom Pepper Roast, Mutton Lonche, Prawn Caldine and more.

Chefs Ebaani and Mathew created Kari Apla as an ode to their roots, spanning both South Indian and Maharashtrian cultures. The name itself combines Malayalam and Marathi to mean ‘Our Curry’. 
The food reflects the philosophy with flavours and ingredients from across the coast, elevated and in perfect harmony.

For dessert, dive into an indulgent Taadgola Jaggery Cake with Cashew Brittle that will pair perfectly with a surprise ice cream flavour by NIC Ice Creams!

Also sip on cocktails crafted for the thali!

Check out the Menu: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1vugMzQFXy7_EFdgR3gkkerA4ha9HfSP3

Limited seats only. Book yours now!

NOTE: Once tickets are booked, please share your meal preference (Vegetarian or Non-Vegetarian) along with any allergies with us on WhatsApp at 8123265307

name: Book Launch: The BWW Book of Emerging Poets
description:
The BWW Book of Emerging Poets is a vibrant anthology brought to life by the Bangalore Writers Workshop under the editorial vision of Bhumika Anand. With 116 poems that span themes of love, loss, identity, and belonging, the collection offers readers a glimpse into the diverse ways poetry can capture our shared human experience. Published by Atta Galatta Publishers , the book is a celebration of new literary talent.

There’s a poem in here for everyone. Join us to meet and celebrate the exceptional poets behind this book. 

Here are the event details

name: Maya Bazaar - Day 2
description:
Day 2 of Namma Bengaluru’s  Queerest Festival!

Explore 150+ homegrown brands, feast on delicious bites at Maya Khaaya, sip refreshing brews at the Maya Baar, and groove to nonstop performances at Maya Manch with 50+ artists, headlined by the powerhouse Wild Wild Women.

Chill with your fam under the open skies, soak in the city’s breezy weekend weather, and spend two unforgettable days at Bengaluru’s most inclusive festival. Family-friendly, pet-friendly, and all-out magical.

🎟 Tickets also available at the venue!

name: Desi Breakfast Club
description:
From the deep, masala-laden bite of Bedmi Poori to the indulgent fluff of Chole Bhature, every plate is a page from a desi breakfast diary.

Craving something richer? Keema Pav brings the heat. And the Parathas? Stuffed, griddled, and made exactly the way they should be — with love, ghee, and no shortcuts.

This isn’t a meal. It’s a morning well spent.

Now Serving Desi Breakfast only at Treat.
Every Sunday 09:30 am - 11:30 am

PLEASE NOTE: We have two time slots available for the Desi Breakfast Club:

Slot 1 - 09:30 AM - 10:15 AM
Slot 2 - 10:30 AM - 11:15 AM

- Once you send in your reservation request, our team will get in touch to confirm your preferred timing. If your chosen slot is full, we’ll happily offer you the next available one.

- To reserve your spot, we’re charging a small fee of ₹200 per person—which is fully redeemable against your meal. You’re free to choose anything from the menu, and if your bill goes over, you can simply settle the difference at the restaurant.

Can’t wait to see you at the Desi Breakfast Club ☀️

name: KR Market Heritage Walk
description: Awaken your senses with an early morning heritage walk through the iconic Krishna Rajendra (KR) Market, one of Bengaluru's oldest and most vibrant commercial hubs. This guided tour, hosted by BengaluruPrayana, delves into the heart of the city's daily life, starting at 8:30 AM. More than just a market, KR Market is a living, breathing organism and a spectacle of color, sound, and fragrance. Famous for its sprawling flower market, which is one of the largest in Asia, the walk offers an unparalleled opportunity to witness the organized chaos as vendors trade mountains of marigolds, roses, and jasmine. Beyond the floral section, the tour will likely navigate through the bustling lanes where vendors sell a vast array of fresh produce, hardware, and religious items. The guide will share stories about the market's history, its architectural significance, and its role as a vital lifeline for the city. This experience is a photographer's dream and a cultural immersion, providing deep insights into the local trade, traditions, and the relentless energy that fuels Bengaluru. It is an essential experience for anyone looking to connect with the authentic, unfiltered spirit of the city.

name: SCC Gourmet Cinema - Delicious
description: Sunset Cinema Club, in collaboration with IFI (French Institute in India) and Hamilton Cocktail Bar, presents "Delicious" (2021), a period drama. This event offers an exquisite evening where the concept of dining is reimagined. The experience pairs a 5-course French tasting menu, inspired by the film's revolutionary spirit, with the screening. The menu includes both vegetarian and non-vegetarian fixed options, and drinks include one alcoholic and one non-alcoholic beverage. Seating is pre-arranged. The movie is in French with English subtitles. The event is currently marked as "Sold Out" on the webpage.

name: Manchester United vs Manchester City
description: This is a promotional event for a live match viewing of the football game between Manchester United and Manchester City. The screening will take place at Church Street Social, starting at 9:00 PM on Sunday, September 14th.

location.name: Church Street Social, Shanthala Nagar
location.address: Church Street Social, Shanthala Nagar, Bangalore

name: Chess Connect: Team Battle
description: Join the Bangalore Chess Club for 'Chess Connect: Team Battle,' an exciting and competitive team-based chess event. This tournament is structured in a Swiss-team blitz format, where teams of four players will compete against each other over six to seven intense rounds. It's a fantastic opportunity for chess enthusiasts to test their skills in a collaborative and fast-paced environment. Participants will have the unique chance to play on the revolutionary AI-powered GoChess Smart Board, blending traditional gameplay with cutting-edge technology. Prizes for the top-performing teams include premium chess sets, rewarding both skill and teamwork. Registration is open for both pre-formed teams and individual players, who will be grouped into teams by the organizers. This ensures everyone has a chance to participate, regardless of whether they come with a full squad. Please note that all tickets are non-refundable. Participants are expected to adhere to the venue's rules and regulations to ensure a smooth and enjoyable experience for everyone. By attending, you also consent to photography and videography, which may be used for promotional purposes by the Bangalore Chess Club. For any inquiries, please contact the organizers at bangalorechessclubofficial@gmail.com. This event is part of the club's mission to foster a vibrant and inclusive chess community in Bangalore.

name: Edible Gardening Workshop
description: Dig into the art of growing your own food at this Edible Gardening Workshop in Koramangala on Sunday, 14th Sept, 10 AM–1 PM. Led by natural farmer Muthukumaran, the session covers soil mixes, composting, moon phases, pest control, and seed saving—plus you’ll take home heirloom vegetable seeds to kickstart your garden. 🌱 Limited to 15 participants, it’s a hands-on, beginner-friendly way to make your kitchen greener.

name: Design Your Own Mythical Creature
description: Design your own mythical creature! Would it be part meerkat, part deer? Would it have wings or claws? In this hands‑on workshop, you’ll create your very own celestial companion inspired by the divine beings in our current exhibition. The session begins with a walkthrough of In Celestial Company, where you’ll meet Garuda, Mooshika, and other legendary creatures, before designing and crafting your own unique mythical friend.

name: Oasis Of Scents
description: An ode to the masterful craft of perfume making and the country’s best noses, this experience will have you develop a discerning sense of smell, understand the nuances of perfumery as a science and art, as well as how fragrances passively contribute to our overall experiences to create a lasting memory. The experience includes navigating through various fragrance notes to formulate your own customised bottle of perfume, under the guidance of an expert. An immersive and interactive perfume making experience under the guidance of legacy perfumers. An understanding of the history of perfume‑making and the nuances of formulating fragrances by hand. The chance to create and take home your own signature fragrance. Learning to develop a keener sense of smell.

location.name: The Biere Club, Ashok Nagar
location.address: The Biere Club, Ashok Nagar, Bangalore

name: New Balance Run Club Bengaluru
description: NBRC Bengaluru x Kothanur Run Club 14th September, 2025. 6:00a.m. Registrations open!

name: Cubbon Crafty Meetups
description: If you're bored on a Sunday and don't know what to do in Bangalore, join us for our weekly Cubbon Crafty Meetups!!

name: Community Drum Circle & Open Jam
description: Registrations Open Now! Join Bangalore Drums Collective for our Community Drum Circle & Open Jam at Bangalore Creative Circus, near Iskcon & Orion Mall, Yeswanthpur on September 14th where rhythm, energy, and community come alive! Date: Sunday, September 14th, 2025 Time: 5:00 PM – 6:30 PM Location: Bangalore Creative Circus, near Iskcon & Orion Mall, Yeswanthpur, BLR @blrcreativecircus What's in store? No experience needed! All instruments welcome! Djembes, Cajons, Darbukas, Guitars & more! Not a drummer? Dance, clap, vibe — come be part of the energy! Contribution: ₹199/person to support our ever-growing community. No drum? Rent a djembe at the venue for ₹250 (first come, first served) Let’s co-create an unforgettable jam full of rhythm, joy, and connection! Register now — link in bio!

name: Bengaluru Kwave Fest 2025
description: Get ready for the 6th edition of the Bengaluru Kwave Fest (BKF), a vibrant, full-day celebration dedicated to the global phenomenon of Hallyu, the Korean Wave. This immersive festival is a must-attend for fans of K-pop, K-dramas, and Korean culture. The day kicks off at 10 AM and promises a packed schedule of activities designed to bring the fan community together. Attendees can look forward to exciting screenings of popular K-pop music videos and K-drama episodes on a big screen, creating a shared viewing experience. A major highlight is the array of stalls offering everything from official and fan-made merchandise to delicious and authentic Korean food, allowing you to taste the flavors of Korea. The festival is also a platform for creative expression, featuring a cosplay competition where fans can dress up as their favorite idols or drama characters. Throughout the day, there will be engaging quizzes to test your K-knowledge, interactive games, and the ever-popular Random Play Dance segment where everyone can jump in and dance to the choruses of iconic K-pop tracks. Local dance and vocal talents will also take the stage to perform covers of beloved songs, showcasing the incredible passion of the Indian Hallyu community. It's an unparalleled opportunity to meet fellow fans, trade photocards, and spend a day completely immersed in the culture you love.

name: Luru Magazine – Writing & Design Workshop
description: Dreaming of launching your own indie mag? ✨ Join Luru Mag’s Meet the Makers Workshop on Sunday, 14th Sept, 2–4 PM at General Items (Gangadhara Chetty Rd). Led by Raghav Krishna and Anisha Tavga, the session dives into the craft of writing, editing, and design—through stories, hands-on exercises, and a peek into how Luru comes alive from words to visuals.

location.name: General items, Gangadhara Chetty Rd
location.address: General items, Gangadhara Chetty Rd, Bangalore

name: Mushroom Yoga Brunch | Nuvedo x Maverick & Farmer Coffee with Chef Sejal & Lisha Sinha
description:
The Mushroom Brunch is a collaborative weekend experience that blends yoga, food, coffee, and fungi culture. Designed as an intimate gathering, it celebrates mushrooms not only as nourishment but as a bridge between wellness, flavor, and community.

🍄 The Concept

This brunch brings together four collaborators—Nuvedo, Maverick & Farmer Coffee, Chef Sejal, and Lisha Sinha, to create a flow where participants can move, learn, taste, and connect. From yoga to mushroom harvesting, live cooking to coffee and conversation, the event is about exploring how mushrooms enrich our lives in unexpected ways.

✨ Facilitators

Nuvedo – India’s functional mushroom brand, cultivating trust, transparency, and fungi-based wellness. Learn more: www.nuvedo.com
Maverick & Farmer – One of India’s few true farm-to-cup coffee brands. With a 140-acre estate in Coorg and a roastery in Bangalore, they produce experimental, award-winning single-estate coffees shipped across India and abroad. Their team, with over a decade of roasting experience, helped pioneer India’s fourth wave of coffee. Learn more: https://www.maverickandfarmer.com/ 
Chef Sejal Agrawal – A vegan, plant-based chef trained at The Vegan School, Goa. Currently a chef at C+C, she also takes on private chef projects, crafting nourishing meals that often give classic non-vegan dishes a vibrant, plant-based twist. Her passion lies in Asian flavors, food R&D, and showing how fun and delicious plant-based eating can be. https://www.instagram.com/chef.sejal/ 
Lisha Sinha – A yoga teacher with over 500 hours of training in Ashtanga, Vinyasa, and Hatha yoga. Lisha integrates breathwork, meditation, and sound in her sessions, inspired by teachers like B.K.S. Iyengar and Sharath Jois. She believes yoga is about presence and resilience, and through her platform Wellness Loop, she creates mindful wellness experiences for individuals and corporates . https://www.instagram.com/lishasinha/ 


📌 Where: Maverick & Farmer Coffee, Gate #3, Gangadhar Chetty Rd, Halasuru, Rukmani Colony, Sivanchetti Gardens, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042 ( https://maps.app.goo.gl/fkCEsqACpZJ3TMEo9 )

📆 Date: September 21st, 2025
⌚ Time: 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM
💰 Cost: INR 1800 + GST (includes all activities and refreshments)
LIMITED SEATS AVAILABLE — Book now to secure your spot!

🔗 REGISTER HERE: https://rzp.io/rzp/Z5kmeRUj 

🗓️ Schedule

9:00 AM – Introduction to functional mushrooms with Nuvedo
9:30 AM – Vinyasa Flow with Lisha Sinha

10:30 AM – Mushroom Brunch

• Live Lion’s Mane mushroom harvest by participants

• Live Cooking with Chef Sejal

• Mushroom-forward vegan menu

• Lion’s Mane Mushroom Coffee with Maverick & Farmer

11:30 AM – Closing circle & reflections

Seats are limited to 20 participants. Reserve your spot to be part of this mindful, flavorful Sunday gathering.With love and spores,

Nuvedo x Maverick & Farmer Coffee with Chef Sejal & Lisha Sinha
